title: RH PetroGas Second Quarter 2025 Earnings: EPS: US$0.003 (vs US$0.005 in 2Q 2024)
description: RH PetroGas ( SGX:T13 ) Second Quarter 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: US$18.7m (down 23% from 2Q 2024...
content:
• EPS: US$0.003 (down from US$0.005 in 2Q 2024).

Trump has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas and these 15 US stocks have developments that are poised to benefit.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Looking ahead, revenue is forecast to decline by 5.6% p.a. on average during the next 3 years, while revenues in the Oil and Gas industry in Asia are expected to remain flat.

Performance of the market in Singapore.

The company's shares are down 1.1% from a week ago.

Don't forget that there may still be risks. For instance, we've identified 1 warning sign for RH PetroGas that you should be aware of.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.



This article by Simply Wall St is general in nature. We provide commentary based on historical data and analyst forecasts only using an unbiased methodology and our articles are not intended to be financial advice. It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.
summary: The US President has pledged to "unleash" American oil and gas, and these 15 US stocks are expected to benefit from this. However, there are risks, with RH PetroGas predicted to decline by 5.6% p.a. on average over the next three years. The company's shares are down 1.1% from a week ago.
shortSummary: Despite the positive outlook for RH PetroGas, the company faces significant declines with declining revenue and ongoing market volatility due to President Trump's policies.

scraped_sources.text:
Results
22
Midstream oil and gas companies, specifically pipeline operators, are well-positioned to benefit from Trump’s executive orders on fossil fuels enacted in early 2025. – – These policies aim to accelerate infrastructure development by streamlining environmental reviews and permitting processes, such as those under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA). The declaration of a "national energy emergency" further empowers these companies by prioritizing pipeline and storage projects to support increased production from newly accessible federal lands and waters. – – The push to "unleash American energy" also amplifies demand for midstream services as upstream production ramps up, particularly in regions like Alaska and offshore areas reopened for drilling. Pipelines and storage facilities will be critical to moving larger volumes of oil and gas efficiently, especially with the renewed emphasis on LNG exports to meet global demand.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1987 | n/a | Francis Chang | www.rhpetrogas.com |
RH PetroGas Limited, an investment holding company, engages in the exploration, development, and production of oil and gas resources in Indonesia. It holds 70% working interests in the Kepala Burung production sharing contract (PSC) that covers an area of approximately 1,030 square kilometers; and the Salawati PSC covering a total area of 1,137 square kilometers onshore and offshore located in the Bird’s Head area of West Papua in eastern Indonesia. The company was formerly known as T8ri-M Technologies Singapore Limited and changed its name to RH PetroGas Limited in November 2009.

argos_summary: The article highlights how President Trump’s 2025 executive orders on fossil fuels are expected to boost U.S. midstream oil and gas companies, listing 22 firms that could benefit from streamlined permitting and increased production on federal lands. It notes that revenue is projected to decline 5.6% annually over the next three years, while Asian oil and gas revenues remain flat, and provides a snapshot of Singapore’s market performance, where the energy sector gained 1.58% over the past week. The piece also focuses on RH PetroGas Limited, a Singapore‑listed Indonesian oil and gas holder, reporting strong earnings growth (11.1% annualized) and a 15.8% net margin, though its stock underperforms the broader SG oil and gas industry and market over the past year. Overall, the article combines policy analysis, company performance data, and market context to assess opportunities and risks in the oil and gas sector.
